GT.content: Derrida thinking gift by way of idiomatic expressions: give a class, donner une facilité, donner le change [hunting expression], etc.
GT.linkedContent: Derrida thinking gift by way of idiomatic expressions: give a class, donner une facilité, donner le change [hunting expression], etc.

LOBL.content: [extensive description] yes of event, yes of iteration, quotes, cites, in accordance w/ strange ring outside of presence, sur-vives
LOBL.linkedContent: [extensive description] yes of event, yes of iteration, quotes, cites, in accordance w/ strange ring outside of presence, sur-vives

LOBL.content: ring is sealed by arrêt de mort (syntax, almost untranslatable, is sealed in this French expression)
LOBL.linkedContent: ring is sealed by arrêt de mort (syntax, almost untranslatable, is sealed in this French expression)

LOBL.content: like death, arrêt remains undecidable, one arrêt marks delay, the other haste [2 syntaxes]
LOBL.linkedContent: like death, arrêt remains undecidable, one arrêt marks delay, the other haste [2 syntaxes]

LOBL.content: suspensive arrêt already [déjà] undecided because it suspends, decisive arrêt undecided
LOBL.linkedContent: suspensive arrêt already [déjà] undecided because it suspends, decisive arrêt undecided

LOBL.content: the minute of living-on has the syntax of a revolution
LOBL.linkedContent: the minute of living-on has the syntax of a revolution

POOF.content: instant of perhaps friendship: causes no ripple in calm waters of semantics
POOF.linkedContent: instant of perhaps friendship: causes no ripple in calm waters of semantics

POOF.content: on difference btwn omega ω [w/out iota & spirit] in “O my friends…” and ᾠ [w/ both] [which, inconceivably, English translation failed to mark], vocative interjection or pronomial dative? > philological haunting, ω [w/out] as crypt w/ twin ghosts, the added spirit (aspiration) in memory or omission > do the friends remain motionless/indifferent in either case?
POOF.linkedContent: on difference btwn omega ω [w/out iota & spirit] in “O my friends…” and ᾠ [w/ both] [which, inconceivably, English translation failed to mark], vocative interjection or pronomial dative? > philological haunting, ω [w/out] as crypt w/ twin ghosts, the added spirit (aspiration) in memory or omission > do the friends remain motionless/indifferent in either case?

POOF.content: Blanchot [on Foucault’s death]: “the intellectual friendship that his death, so painful to me, today allows me to declare to him, as (tandis que) I recall the words attributed by Diogenes Laertes to Aristotle: ‘Oh my friends, there is no friend’” > incredible audacity of this tandis que, and the singular use of the colon, an act of punctuation that unfurls a veil of mourning—will one have ever punctuated w/ more rigor?
POOF.linkedContent: Blanchot [on Foucault’s death]: “the intellectual friendship that his death, so painful to me, today allows me to declare to him, as (tandis que) I recall the words attributed by Diogenes Laertes to Aristotle: ‘Oh my friends, there is no friend’” > incredible audacity of this tandis que, and the singular use of the colon, an act of punctuation that unfurls a veil of mourning—will one have ever punctuated w/ more rigor?

POO.content: in syntax of “X: A Critical Reader,” who’s reading whom, who’s the subject?
POO.linkedContent: in syntax of “X: A Critical Reader,” who’s reading whom, who’s the subject?

POO.content: the secret is the possibility of homonymy, and mimesis
POO.linkedContent: the secret is the possibility of homonymy, and mimesis

SEC.content: Husserl’s interest is in purely logical grammar not pure grammar > “the green is or,” unacceptable in context determined by a will to know, still signifies an example of agrammaticality
SEC.linkedContent: Husserl’s interest is in purely logical grammar not pure grammar > “the green is or,” unacceptable in context determined by a will to know, still signifies an example of agrammaticality

SEC.content: in French “le vert est ou” can become “le vert est où” or “le verre est où”
SEC.linkedContent: in French “le vert est ou” can become “le vert est où” or “le verre est où”

VM.content: “syntax of the Site whose archaic description is not legible on the metal of language cannot be erased: it is this metal itself, its too somber solidity and its too shining brilliance”
VM.linkedContent: “syntax of the Site whose archaic description is not legible on the metal of language cannot be erased: it is this metal itself, its too somber solidity and its too shining brilliance”

OH.content: what is proper to a culture is not to be identical to itself, culture of oneself as culture of other, gathered and divided at the heart, home: [violent syntax] différence (d’) avec soi
OH.linkedContent: what is proper to a culture is not to be identical to itself, culture of oneself as culture of other, gathered and divided at the heart, home: [violent syntax] différence (d’) avec soi

PAS.content: if I write slowly you can hear si j’étais là (if/yes I was there) in three ways
PAS.linkedContent: if I write slowly you can hear si j’étais là (if/yes I was there) in three ways

PPHS.content: for Hegel, machine works as a negation w/out relève, thus Hegel could never think a machine that could work! that which doesn’t work in service of meaning: pure loss
PPHS.linkedContent: for Hegel, machine works as a negation w/out relève, thus Hegel could never think a machine that could work! that which doesn’t work in service of meaning: pure loss

PPHS.content: but Derrida sees machine working by itself, outside > Hegel’s logic, syntax, concepts, engaged in system of this unpower [of course, not enough to “essentialize” technology]
PPHS.linkedContent: but Derrida sees machine working by itself, outside > Hegel’s logic, syntax, concepts, engaged in system of this unpower [of course, not enough to “essentialize” technology]

SH.content: in shibboleth (river), there’s suspension of meaning, almost opposite of phenomenological “epokhe,” which preserves meaning > those who couldn’t pronounce “shi” marked themselves as unable to remark a mark thus coded
SH.linkedContent: in shibboleth (river), there’s suspension of meaning, almost opposite of phenomenological “epokhe,” which preserves meaning > those who couldn’t pronounce “shi” marked themselves as unable to remark a mark thus coded

F.content: method & element of The Magic Word: new cryptology, anasemic retranscription of all concepts, “antisemantics”
F.linkedContent: method & element of The Magic Word: new cryptology, anasemic retranscription of all concepts, “antisemantics”

WM.content: for Aristotle, onoma can be both verbs & nouns, anything that has phōnē sēmantikē, anything that has intelligible meaning outside syntax, not a syncategorem
WM.linkedContent: for Aristotle, onoma can be both verbs & nouns, anything that has phōnē sēmantikē, anything that has intelligible meaning outside syntax, not a syncategorem

WM.content: Leibniz seeking to find hidden concept or name beneath all syntactical relations
WM.linkedContent: Leibniz seeking to find hidden concept or name beneath all syntactical relations

WM.content: Fontanier: prepositions, conjunctions, adverbs not tied to substantive idea, just ways of seeing
WM.linkedContent: Fontanier: prepositions, conjunctions, adverbs not tied to substantive idea, just ways of seeing

WM.content: Aristotle: noun as element of metaphor, first semantic unity, smallest signifying element, composite phōnē sēmantikē, each of its elements are insignificant (asēmos) w/out meaning; noun is different from verb only in atemporality
WM.linkedContent: Aristotle: noun as element of metaphor, first semantic unity, smallest signifying element, composite phōnē sēmantikē, each of its elements are insignificant (asēmos) w/out meaning; noun is different from verb only in atemporality

WM.content: for Bachelard, the hidden (fire) is what demands metaphors, Derrida explains how this conceptualization, despite fact that Bachelard appeals to syntax, “a poetic mind is a syntax of metaphors,” still amounts to metaphor of the same > here, all metaphors have a semantic focal point, the hidden fire as life, nature
WM.linkedContent: for Bachelard, the hidden (fire) is what demands metaphors, Derrida explains how this conceptualization, despite fact that Bachelard appeals to syntax, “a poetic mind is a syntax of metaphors,” still amounts to metaphor of the same > here, all metaphors have a semantic focal point, the hidden fire as life, nature

WM.content: most invariable characteristic of concept of metaphor: unity/continuity of meaning dominates play of syntax, subordination of syntax
WM.linkedContent: most invariable characteristic of concept of metaphor: unity/continuity of meaning dominates play of syntax, subordination of syntax

WM.content: because metaphoric is plural from the start, it cannot escape syntax, it organizes its division w/in syntax, cannot be what it is except in erasing itself, indefinitely constructing its destruction
WM.linkedContent: because metaphoric is plural from the start, it cannot escape syntax, it organizes its division w/in syntax, cannot be what it is except in erasing itself, indefinitely constructing its destruction

DS.content: Mallarmé’s coils, shells, motifs, lustre of title > Mallarmé’s only use [?] of word syntaxier (syntaxer): “never would the sovereign bow fall”
DS.linkedContent: Mallarmé’s coils, shells, motifs, lustre of title > Mallarmé’s only use [?] of word syntaxier (syntaxer): “never would the sovereign bow fall”

DS.content: double mark, mark erases mark, undecidable stroke > this syntax escapes pertinence of truth, inscribes truth w/in its play [“Mallarmé exemplifies this”—suspect such a claim]
DS.linkedContent: double mark, mark erases mark, undecidable stroke > this syntax escapes pertinence of truth, inscribes truth w/in its play [“Mallarmé exemplifies this”—suspect such a claim]

DS.content: displacement w/out reversal of Platonic heritage, always an effect of syntax, writing, language—not simply dialectical overturning of concept (signified)
DS.linkedContent: displacement w/out reversal of Platonic heritage, always an effect of syntax, writing, language—not simply dialectical overturning of concept (signified)

DS.content: dialectic is beginning and end of philosophy, Mallarmé marks it w/ his syntax at the point of its sterility [MOP] > a point that will be called, analogically, provisionally, undecidable
DS.linkedContent: dialectic is beginning and end of philosophy, Mallarmé marks it w/ his syntax at the point of its sterility [MOP] > a point that will be called, analogically, provisionally, undecidable

DS.content: Derrida not using hymen like Hegel used Aufhebung, Urteil (contradictory layers of signification, depth); what counts for hymen is form or syntactical praxis that (de)composes it
DS.linkedContent: Derrida not using hymen like Hegel used Aufhebung, Urteil (contradictory layers of signification, depth); what counts for hymen is form or syntactical praxis that (de)composes it

DS.content: the word hymen could be lost, and its function would remain: we’ve been making believe everything can be traced to this name [see GOD p. 116], simply possesses a certain economic condensation, accumulation
DS.linkedContent: the word hymen could be lost, and its function would remain: we’ve been making believe everything can be traced to this name [see GOD p. 116], simply possesses a certain economic condensation, accumulation

DS.content: [explanation on how syntax counts for “undecidability,” not lexical richness] hymen in text (crime, incest, suicide, simulacrum) inscribed at very tip (à la pointe) of indecision
DS.linkedContent: [explanation on how syntax counts for “undecidability,” not lexical richness] hymen in text (crime, incest, suicide, simulacrum) inscribed at very tip (à la pointe) of indecision

DS.content: hymen in relation to inter-, “btwn,” a syncategorem, syntactical plug, even Husserl calls this an incomplete signification, its syntactical (de)composition can never be mastered
DS.linkedContent: hymen in relation to inter-, “btwn,” a syncategorem, syntactical plug, even Husserl calls this an incomplete signification, its syntactical (de)composition can never be mastered

DS.content: like Freud’s unconscious (syntax of “hymen” tolerates, remains insensitive, to contradiction)
DS.linkedContent: like Freud’s unconscious (syntax of “hymen” tolerates, remains insensitive, to contradiction)

DS.content: “btwn” re-marks its semantic void, becomes quasi-categorem, marks opening btwn syntax/semantics > its meaning: possibility of syntax, spacing [Spinoza, “btwns” in Hebrew]
DS.linkedContent: “btwn” re-marks its semantic void, becomes quasi-categorem, marks opening btwn syntax/semantics > its meaning: possibility of syntax, spacing [Spinoza, “btwns” in Hebrew]

DS.content: [example from Mallarmé of undecidability of syntax]
DS.linkedContent: [example from Mallarmé of undecidability of syntax]

DS.content: in the morgue you’ve been able to read the folding (vous aurez pu lire que la pliure)
DS.linkedContent: in the morgue you’ve been able to read the folding (vous aurez pu lire que la pliure)

DS.content: syntax of hymen’s fold makes it impossible to arrest its play of indecision [i.e. to stop it on “mental,” or “imaginary”]
DS.linkedContent: syntax of hymen’s fold makes it impossible to arrest its play of indecision [i.e. to stop it on “mental,” or “imaginary”]

DS.content: [re: Mallarmé’s use of Or] Or (substantive noun/adverb of time), gold turned to nothing; Igitur, adverb-name (also means “therefore”), has affinities w/ Or, or marks the hour (today) > temps d’or, “Il Signor,” “qui s’ignore,” “signe or,” in the golden antre of a glottis (glossa, gold ingot, lingot, lingua) > throw of linguistic dice
DS.linkedContent: [re: Mallarmé’s use of Or] Or (substantive noun/adverb of time), gold turned to nothing; Igitur, adverb-name (also means “therefore”), has affinities w/ Or, or marks the hour (today) > temps d’or, “Il Signor,” “qui s’ignore,” “signe or,” in the golden antre of a glottis (glossa, gold ingot, lingot, lingua) > throw of linguistic dice

DS.content: infinite unfolding of aviary, of fan > ailes, elle, l, il—li (lit)
DS.linkedContent: infinite unfolding of aviary, of fan > ailes, elle, l, il—li (lit)

POS.content: discourses of reduction and misconstrual: thematism, sociologism, historicism, psychologism (can be avoided by formal/syntactic work)
POS.linkedContent: discourses of reduction and misconstrual: thematism, sociologism, historicism, psychologism (can be avoided by formal/syntactic work)

ROP.content: Lacan speaks of the insuccès—Derrida transforms it: “l’insuccès qui échoue à arriver” > playing w/ syntax of to: 1) I do not arrive 2) I fail to arrive because I arrive
ROP.linkedContent: Lacan speaks of the insuccès—Derrida transforms it: “l’insuccès qui échoue à arriver” > playing w/ syntax of to: 1) I do not arrive 2) I fail to arrive because I arrive

DIF.content: that pyramidal silence btwn “e” and “a” can only function in phonetic writing reminds us there’s no pure phonetic writing (functions by admitting nonphonetic “signs”: punctuation, spacing)
DIF.linkedContent: that pyramidal silence btwn “e” and “a” can only function in phonetic writing reminds us there’s no pure phonetic writing (functions by admitting nonphonetic “signs”: punctuation, spacing)

O.content: dissemination: doesn’t simply place plural in effervescence > il s’agite de la contradiction sans fin, marked by undecidable syntax of plus
O.linkedContent: dissemination: doesn’t simply place plural in effervescence > il s’agite de la contradiction sans fin, marked by undecidable syntax of plus

RGE.content: this stratagem, the sovereign operation, play w/ syntax, does not subordinate itself to an anticipated discourse
RGE.linkedContent: this stratagem, the sovereign operation, play w/ syntax, does not subordinate itself to an anticipated discourse

REST.content: DS turns around points of ballerina, “la syntaxe du point et du pas” > each pair referring to some other, signifying too the operation of signifying
REST.linkedContent: DS turns around points of ballerina, “la syntaxe du point et du pas” > each pair referring to some other, signifying too the operation of signifying

REST.content: Derrida’s reading of Freud’s shoe fetish: shoe replaces that which is lacking not because of its form but because of its directional situation > syntax of a movement upwards
REST.linkedContent: Derrida’s reading of Freud’s shoe fetish: shoe replaces that which is lacking not because of its form but because of its directional situation > syntax of a movement upwards

REST.content: “according to the circumstances,” [Freud’s bisexuality of most dream-symbols] also occurs acc. syntax irreducible to semantic or “symbolic” substantiality
REST.linkedContent: “according to the circumstances,” [Freud’s bisexuality of most dream-symbols] also occurs acc. syntax irreducible to semantic or “symbolic” substantiality

REST.content: “to tell the truth”: necessary to hold in reserve excess of interpretation, supplement of reading—for the idiom of a syntactic variation > absolute idiom is name of a lure, but absolute “pas d’idiome” [see p. 381] does not authorize contentment w/ symbolic equivalences, “w/ off-the-peg universals (d’universaux de confection)”
REST.linkedContent: “to tell the truth”: necessary to hold in reserve excess of interpretation, supplement of reading—for the idiom of a syntactic variation > absolute idiom is name of a lure, but absolute “pas d’idiome” [see p. 381] does not authorize contentment w/ symbolic equivalences, “w/ off-the-peg universals (d’universaux de confection)”

REST.content: restitution, remise des chaussures, snares (ret) of these shoes formed by re- prefixes, revenir
REST.linkedContent: restitution, remise des chaussures, snares (ret) of these shoes formed by re- prefixes, revenir

REST.content: Derrida’s “close reading,” a policing, “if police there is (and isn’t there always),” played out via the size (pointure) of a comma, that which separates “pair” (of shoes) from “the product” > not a temporal interval but a syntactic fact
REST.linkedContent: Derrida’s “close reading,” a policing, “if police there is (and isn’t there always),” played out via the size (pointure) of a comma, that which separates “pair” (of shoes) from “the product” > not a temporal interval but a syntactic fact

REST.content: [spectrality of stricture]: il s’est rendu dans/avec/à /( ) ses chaussures ——meanings knot/unknot in lace/snare of syntax (tous les sens se nouent et se dénouent dans le lacet de cette syntax)
REST.linkedContent: [spectrality of stricture]: il s’est rendu dans/avec/à /( ) ses chaussures ——meanings knot/unknot in lace/snare of syntax (tous les sens se nouent et se dénouent dans le lacet de cette syntax)

DST.content: ne pas ne pas: redoubles movement of negation through syntactical formation
DST.linkedContent: ne pas ne pas: redoubles movement of negation through syntactical formation

DST.content: not do something that consists in not doing: ineluctable, unavoidable > sur-négation
DST.linkedContent: not do something that consists in not doing: ineluctable, unavoidable > sur-négation

DST.content: neither work of dialectic nor unconscious denegation [neither Hegel nor Freud]
DST.linkedContent: neither work of dialectic nor unconscious denegation [neither Hegel nor Freud]

PIO.content: inventive event as both quotation & narrative [re: “Fable”], allegory & tautegory > event of an utterance, its vis inventiva, inseparable from syntactic play, also an art of disposition
PIO.linkedContent: inventive event as both quotation & narrative [re: “Fable”], allegory & tautegory > event of an utterance, its vis inventiva, inseparable from syntactic play, also an art of disposition

RM.content: Derrida has regularly questioned (w/ insistence that might be judged tiresome) the “privilege of the name,” opposing its primacy w/ attention to syntactic motif
RM.linkedContent: Derrida has regularly questioned (w/ insistence that might be judged tiresome) the “privilege of the name,” opposing its primacy w/ attention to syntactic motif

TR.content: de Man: w/in certain perspective, no use of language that’s not radically formal, mechanical, even when concealed by aesthetic, formalistic delusions
TR.linkedContent: de Man: w/in certain perspective, no use of language that’s not radically formal, mechanical, even when concealed by aesthetic, formalistic delusions

TR.content: Derrida plays on syntactical error, etymology, unconscious narration: in early proof of OG, Rousseau’s “I was as if I had committed incest” came back as “…committed insect”
TR.linkedContent: Derrida plays on syntactical error, etymology, unconscious narration: in early proof of OG, Rousseau’s “I was as if I had committed incest” came back as “…committed insect”

EJQB.content: to write: to confuse ontology & grammar; grammar: in which are inscribed all dislocations of dead syntax, all aggressions perpetrated by speech against language, every questioning of the letter
EJQB.linkedContent: to write: to confuse ontology & grammar; grammar: in which are inscribed all dislocations of dead syntax, all aggressions perpetrated by speech against language, every questioning of the letter

EJQB.content: all these tortures are forgotten in literature, as mortifications, as ruses of life
EJQB.linkedContent: all these tortures are forgotten in literature, as mortifications, as ruses of life

PSSS.content: psychoanalysis as another name for “w/out alibi”: questions radical evil or an even worse evil > only psychoanalytic revolution up to task of taking account of grammatical syntax, reflexivity: [“I you we made I you we suffer”]
PSSS.linkedContent: psychoanalysis as another name for “w/out alibi”: questions radical evil or an even worse evil > only psychoanalytic revolution up to task of taking account of grammatical syntax, reflexivity: [“I you we made I you we suffer”]

D.content: s’il n’y a pas de hors-texte [outside the text, extratext], it’s because le graphique généralisé a toujours déjà commencé: il n’y a rien avant le texte, always implanted in “prior” writing [no pretext that’s not already text]
D.linkedContent: s’il n’y a pas de hors-texte [outside the text, extratext], it’s because le graphique généralisé a toujours déjà commencé: il n’y a rien avant le texte, always implanted in “prior” writing [no pretext that’s not already text]

D.content: [re: Numbers] paragrammatical effects, cut w/in graphic substance retains/distorts traces of all sorts, small differences in repetition, imbedding
D.linkedContent: [re: Numbers] paragrammatical effects, cut w/in graphic substance retains/distorts traces of all sorts, small differences in repetition, imbedding

LI.content: Derrida extracts certain predicates that can be extended to every mark [thus, emphasis on graphematic predicate is not “genuine,” Sarl is right: there’s nothing especially graphematic about separation of sign from signified]
LI.linkedContent: Derrida extracts certain predicates that can be extended to every mark [thus, emphasis on graphematic predicate is not “genuine,” Sarl is right: there’s nothing especially graphematic about separation of sign from signified]

LI.content: [re: SEC] Derrida replaces “of God” w/ “of writing,” where iterability of the proof (of God) produces writing > name of God drawn into graphematic drift (dérive): does name of God refer to God or name of God? “perhaps” of “that it perhaps does not exist” marks fact that “possibility” of graphematics places writing (remainder) outside ontology > [God should exist but in relation to name/reference that “perhaps” does not]
LI.linkedContent: [re: SEC] Derrida replaces “of God” w/ “of writing,” where iterability of the proof (of God) produces writing > name of God drawn into graphematic drift (dérive): does name of God refer to God or name of God? “perhaps” of “that it perhaps does not exist” marks fact that “possibility” of graphematics places writing (remainder) outside ontology > [God should exist but in relation to name/reference that “perhaps” does not]

LI.content: the rest of the trace, its remains (restance), neither present nor absent
LI.linkedContent: the rest of the trace, its remains (restance), neither present nor absent

LI.content: or, or rather, even parentheses, i.e. “citation (iterability)” > not genus/species, not identity, classical logic fractured in its code, parasitic contamination entame all these relations, which is why words have to be qualified, supplemented by others
LI.linkedContent: or, or rather, even parentheses, i.e. “citation (iterability)” > not genus/species, not identity, classical logic fractured in its code, parasitic contamination entame all these relations, which is why words have to be qualified, supplemented by others

LI.content: [re: citationality (iterability)] parentheses do not mark synonyms/identification > iterability marks citationality in its possibility, its “graphematic root”
LI.linkedContent: [re: citationality (iterability)] parentheses do not mark synonyms/identification > iterability marks citationality in its possibility, its “graphematic root”

ATM.content: the grammatical utterance [“here I am”?] is there, but put out of joint (disloqué), making room (that is not a home) for an agrammaticality of the gift assigned from the other (depuis l’autre)
ATM.linkedContent: the grammatical utterance [“here I am”?] is there, but put out of joint (disloqué), making room (that is not a home) for an agrammaticality of the gift assigned from the other (depuis l’autre)

ATM.content: incorporating what it can’t assimilate, quoting the uncitable consists in accusing language [appearing as witness & accused], (sur)rendered (offerre) to a gift, as a gift which language can’t open up to on its own
ATM.linkedContent: incorporating what it can’t assimilate, quoting the uncitable consists in accusing language [appearing as witness & accused], (sur)rendered (offerre) to a gift, as a gift which language can’t open up to on its own

NOY.content: when thought and the word (la parole) given in writing merge (se confond) at the heart of the same time (au coeur du même temps); chance encounter in singularity of “graph,” coincidence of the cut (la coupure) and the opening (l’ouverture)
NOY.linkedContent: when thought and the word (la parole) given in writing merge (se confond) at the heart of the same time (au coeur du même temps); chance encounter in singularity of “graph,” coincidence of the cut (la coupure) and the opening (l’ouverture)

OG.content: passivity of speech can’t be distinguished from relation btwn unconsciousness of language and spacing (pause, blank, punctuation, interval) that constitutes origin of signification in general
OG.linkedContent: passivity of speech can’t be distinguished from relation btwn unconsciousness of language and spacing (pause, blank, punctuation, interval) that constitutes origin of signification in general

OG.content: becoming-space of time & becoming-time of space mark dead time w/in presence of living present > dead time is at work, les blancs take on importance > limit of phenomenology
OG.linkedContent: becoming-space of time & becoming-time of space mark dead time w/in presence of living present > dead time is at work, les blancs take on importance > limit of phenomenology

OG.content: [vis-à-vis Rousseau] punctuation best example of nonphonetic mark in the interior of writing > its impotence re: accent isolates proper misery of writing
OG.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Rousseau] punctuation best example of nonphonetic mark in the interior of writing > its impotence re: accent isolates proper misery of writing

CIR.content: nongrammatical syntax that remains to be invented to speak name of God
CIR.linkedContent: nongrammatical syntax that remains to be invented to speak name of God

SPEC.content: Derrida corrupts (détourne) “properly Freudian” usage of speculation [i.e. a mode proper mode of research]: as production of surplus value, overflows, the given of the gift, oblique object of Freud’s discourse > Freud’s bias of procedure interests Derrida, the scene of what makes Freud write: faire faire, laisser faire, faire écrire, laisser écrire: the syntax of these operations not given [in Freud]
SPEC.linkedContent: Derrida corrupts (détourne) “properly Freudian” usage of speculation [i.e. a mode proper mode of research]: as production of surplus value, overflows, the given of the gift, oblique object of Freud’s discourse > Freud’s bias of procedure interests Derrida, the scene of what makes Freud write: faire faire, laisser faire, faire écrire, laisser écrire: the syntax of these operations not given [in Freud]

SPEC.content: detour, Umweg, breaks open the path (frayage) > Freud does not interrogate the graphics of the différant detour for itself (can it ever be for itself?)
SPEC.linkedContent: detour, Umweg, breaks open the path (frayage) > Freud does not interrogate the graphics of the différant detour for itself (can it ever be for itself?)

SPEC.content: all the interlacings of fort:da, tout ce qui s’envoi in graphics of repetition that dislocates summary “triangle” > le trait oedipien n’est qu’une rection pour le fil conducteur de la bobine [Oedipus most narrowly restricted effects of above repetition’s graphics]
SPEC.linkedContent: all the interlacings of fort:da, tout ce qui s’envoi in graphics of repetition that dislocates summary “triangle” > le trait oedipien n’est qu’une rection pour le fil conducteur de la bobine [Oedipus most narrowly restricted effects of above repetition’s graphics]

SPEC.content: index of original normality [at this point of Beyond…] is the “primitive,” not child: primitives don’t face death [?], anxiety about death has no proper content
SPEC.linkedContent: index of original normality [at this point of Beyond…] is the “primitive,” not child: primitives don’t face death [?], anxiety about death has no proper content

SPEC.content: death is the analogon of castration > castration not incompatible w/ thesis of death drive if one refers to syntaxic articulation of athesis: Derrida’s pointing to “it” at this moment
SPEC.linkedContent: death is the analogon of castration > castration not incompatible w/ thesis of death drive if one refers to syntaxic articulation of athesis: Derrida’s pointing to “it” at this moment

SPEC.content: w/ Causa, l’Autre Chose—no opposition btwn pleasure & unpleasure, w/in & beyond, life & death: graphics of strictural supplement not oppositional, knowns no negation, no lack; in graphics, desire is sans “sans,” is of a “sans sans sans”
SPEC.linkedContent: w/ Causa, l’Autre Chose—no opposition btwn pleasure & unpleasure, w/in & beyond, life & death: graphics of strictural supplement not oppositional, knowns no negation, no lack; in graphics, desire is sans “sans,” is of a “sans sans sans”

CHOR.content: some can’t see beyond end of phallic forms in SP (bisexual complication of style, spur, umbrella): those people do not read the syntax and punctuation of a given sentence, arresting the text in a position, settling on a thesis, meaning or truth

CHOR.content: how can one breathe w/out punctuation, w/out multiplicities of rhythm, steps, how can one dance?
